text:
It would be very useful for those of us forced to use JNI to have a way of 
compiling a C file. Even limited support would be useful.
Here is an example of what I have to do now to use MinGW to compile a JNI 
source file:
  <target name="rp1210a.check">
    <uptodate targetfile="itec/util/rp1210a/RP1210A_Adaptor.dll" 
property="rp1210a.newer">
      <srcfiles dir="itec/util/rp1210a" includes="RP1210A_Adaptor.c" />
    </uptodate>
  </target>
  <target name="rp1210a" depends="rp1210a.check" unless="rp1210a.newer">
    <exec executable="gcc">
      <arg line="-g -O2 -c -I${jdk}/include -I${jdk}/include/win32 -g 
itec/util/rp1210a/RP1210A_Adaptor.c -o build/RP1210A_Adaptor.o" />
    </exec>
    <exec executable="dllwrap">
      <arg line="--add-stdcall-alias -o itec/util/rp1210a/RP1210A_Adaptor.dll -
s build/RP1210A_Adaptor.o" />
    </exec>
  </target>
creator: David.Holscher@nav-international.com
